title: Post-9/11 GI Bill
description: Provides up to 36 months of education benefits for veterans who served after September 10, 2001, covering tuition, housing, books, and supplies at approved institutions.

title: Montgomery GI Bill - Active Duty
description: Offers education benefits for veterans who served on active duty.

title: Veteran Readiness and Employment (VR&E)
description: Offers education and training services to veterans with service-connected disabilities, helping them prepare for, find, and maintain suitable employment.

title: Yellow Ribbon Program
description: Offers additional education benefits for veterans attending private colleges and out-of-state institutions, with schools and VA sharing the cost of tuition and fees.

title: Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance (DEA)
description: Provides education benefits to dependents of veterans who are disabled or deceased.

title: Veterans Upward Bound (VUB)
description: Provides instructional programs and support services to help veterans transition to postsecondary education, focusing on academic refresher courses and college preparation.

title: Tutorial Assistance Program
description: Provides tutorial help for veterans using VA educational benefits.

title: Veterans Technology Education Courses (VET TEC)
description: Helps veterans gain high-tech skills through training programs.

title: On-the-Job Training and Apprenticeships
description: Provides support for veterans pursuing on-the-job training and apprenticeships.

title: Work-Study Program
description: Allows veterans to earn money while pursuing their education.

title: Veterans Educational Assistance Program (VEAP)
description: A $2-to-$1 government-match program for veterans who served between 1977 and 1985, providing funds for education and training.

title: Edith Nourse Rogers STEM Scholarship
description: Provides extra benefits for veterans and Fry Scholars pursuing STEM degrees or teaching certifications beyond standard GI Bill limits.

title: Military OneSource Education Resources
description: Provides education and career resources, including counseling and tools to find schools, for veterans and service members.

title: Transition Assistance Program (TAP)
description: Helps transitioning service members prepare for civilian life with education and career planning resources and workshops.

title: VA.gov Training Site for Veterans
description: Offers free online courses for veterans on topics like problem-solving and parenting to enhance personal and professional skills.

title: FEMA Independent Study Certifications
description: Provides free online certifications that align with military experience, enhancing veterans' resumes for civilian careers.

title: VA Rural Veterans Resources
description: Offers education and support resources tailored for veterans in rural areas, including access to training programs.

title: VA Center for Minority Veterans Support
description: Provides education and support resources for minority veterans, addressing cultural needs and opportunities.

title: VA Hispanic Employment Program
description: Offers education and employment resources specifically for Hispanic veterans, including training opportunities.

title: Department of Education for Veterans and Families
description: Provides information on education rights and accommodations for veterans and their families, including federal aid options.

title: Forever GI Bill STEM Extension
description: Extends GI Bill benefits for veterans pursuing STEM degrees requiring more than 36 months of study.

title: NSF GEOPaths Program

title: NSF Veterans Research Supplement Program
description: Connects veterans with research opportunities under active NSF grants, fostering education and career development.

description: Provides integrative health programs with therapy and yoga. Supports veteran mental and physical wellness.

title: Warrior Wellness Solutions
description: Offers wellness programs combining mental and physical health support. Includes counseling and fitness aid.

title: Warrior2Warrior
description: Connects veterans with peers for mental health support. Offers mentoring and support groups.

title: Wounded Healer Project
description: Provides free counseling and peer support for PTSD. Offers therapy for veteran emotional recovery.

title: Wounded Warriors Family Support
description: Offers mental health resources and family support for veterans. Includes counseling and retreats.

title: Zero Day
description: Provides counseling and housing to prevent veteran suicide. Offers crisis intervention and support.

title: Paralyzed Veterans of America
description: Supports veterans with spinal cord injuries via advocacy and home modifications. Enhances physical independence.

title: VETWOD
description: Promotes veteran well-being through fitness events. Connects veterans for mental and physical health.

title: Catch a Lift Fund
description: Offers gym memberships and fitness programs for wounded veterans. Boosts physical and mental health.

title: Backpacks for Life Inc.
description: Supplies essentials to homeless veterans with mental health support. Aids housing and employment needs.

title: Bob Woodruff Family Foundation
description: Funds mental health and PTSD programs for veterans and families. Supports community reintegration.

title: Everyone for Vets
description: Provides free dental care to veterans, enhancing physical and mental well-being nationwide.

title: Freedom Alliance
description: Supports wounded veterans with therapy, sports, and mental health aid. Enhances recovery and independence.

title: Gary Sinise Foundation
description: Builds smart homes and offers mental health support for wounded veterans. Boosts independence.

title: Green Beret Foundation
description: Offers mental health care and family support for Green Berets. Includes suicide prevention aid.

title: Healing4Heroes Inc.
description: Trains service dogs for veterans with PTSD and disabilities. Provides emotional support nationwide.

title: Homes for our Troops
description: Builds custom homes for injured post-9/11 veterans. Enhances physical health and quality of life.

title: Military Warriors Support Foundation
description: Offers mortgage-free homes and mental health support for wounded veterans. Aids family wellness.

title: Pets Enriching Troop Association
description: Provides pet therapy to reduce veteran stress and improve mental health. Offers emotional support.

title: Puppies Behind Bars
description: Trains service dogs for wounded veterans via inmates. Aids PTSD and physical assistance needs.

title: Semper K9 Assistance Dogs
description: Provides shelter-trained service dogs for veterans with PTSD. Supports mental and physical health.

title: Swords to Plowshares
description: Offers mental health counseling and housing for veterans. Prevents homelessness with healthcare support.

title: Warfighter Foundation
description: Provides mental health programs and peer support for warfighters. Fosters resilience and recovery.

title: Working Dogs for Vets
description: Trains service dogs for veterans with PTSD and disabilities. Enhances mental and physical well-being.

title: Wounded Warrior Support Network
description: Offers mental health resources and peer support for wounded veterans. Aids recovery and integration.

title: VA Home Loan Program
description: Offers VA-guaranteed loans with no down payment and low rates to help veterans purchase, build, or improve homes.

title: Specially Adapted Housing (SAH) Grant
description: Provides grants to veterans with service-connected disabilities to adapt or buy homes suited to their accessibility needs.

title: Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance (SGLI)
description: Affordable life insurance for active-duty members, convertible to VGLI post-service for continued coverage.

title: Veterans' Group Life Insurance (VGLI)
description: Renewable term life insurance for veterans transitioning from SGLI, ensuring long-term financial protection.

title: Service-Disabled Veterans Insurance (S-DVI)
description: Life insurance for veterans with service-connected disabilities, offering financial security for dependents.

title: VA Legal Services for Veterans
description: Connects veterans to free legal clinics and pro-bono services for assistance with benefits and legal matters.

title: VA Beneficiary Financial Counseling Service
description: Free financial counseling for VA life insurance beneficiaries to manage funds and plan effectively.

title: VA Financial Literacy Resources
description: Offers tools and links for veterans to improve budgeting, reduce debt, and enhance financial skills.

title: VA National Veterans Sports Programs and Special Events
description: Features adaptive sports like Wheelchair Games to boost veterans' physical health and social connections.

title: VA Recreation Therapy Service
description: Delivers recreational and arts therapies to enhance veterans' mental and physical well-being.

title: VA Travel Pay Reimbursement
description: Covers travel costs for veterans attending approved medical appointments, easing access to healthcare.

title: VA Center for Development and Civic Engagement (CDCE)
description: Coordinates volunteer opportunities for veterans to engage with and support their communities.

title: Veteran Community Partnerships (VCP)
description: Links VA facilities with local groups to expand veterans' access to community resources and support.

title: Veterans Housing Alliance (VHA) - Homebuyers Grant Program
description: Provides financial aid for closing costs to help veterans purchase homes, targeting first-time buyers with no repayment required.

title: Military Housing Assistance Fund (MHAF)
description: Offers closing cost assistance for veterans buying homes, bridging the financial gap for military families, excluding AK, OH, NY.

title: Soldier Next Door Program
description: Grants and down payment assistance for military and veterans to buy homes, with extra benefits for military families.

title: American Armed Forces Mutual Aid Association (AAFMAA)
description: Non-profit providing life insurance and financial solutions tailored for military members and veterans to ensure family security.

title: VeteransPlus
description: Offers financial literacy, coaching, and assessments to improve veterans' financial security with personalized support and outreach.

title: Veterans Legal Institute (VLI)
description: Provides pro bono legal help for low-income veterans on VA claims, discharge upgrades, and expungements in CA.

title: Veteran Recreation Corporation
description: Supports veterans with outdoor recreation like hiking and fishing to promote mental health and coping mechanisms.

title: Veterans Expeditions
description: Organizes veteran-led outdoor trips (backpacking, rafting) for healing and creates outdoor industry jobs for veterans.

title: Freedom Hunters
description: Offers hunting, fishing, and outdoor adventures for veterans, fostering camaraderie and conservation partnerships.

title: Patriot Anglers
description: Engages military and veteran families with fishing opportunities to enhance recreation and camaraderie.

title: Vacation for Warriors
description: Provides free vacations for combat-injured soldiers, aiding recovery with support from airlines and hotels.

title: Team Rubicon
description: Veteran-led humanitarian group deploys to disaster areas, offering volunteering and community service opportunities.

title: Help Heal Veterans
description: Supplies therapeutic craft kits to veterans for healing from PTSD, depression, and mobility issues.

title: Wounded Warrior Project
description: Supports wounded veterans with recreation, community programs, and resources for physical and mental wellness.

title: USO (United Service Organizations)
description: Provides travel assistance, recreational activities, and support for service members and families nationwide.

title: Backcountry Hunters & Anglers - Armed Forces Initiative
description: Introduces military community to public lands and waters, offering a conservation mission to service members and their families. Teaches hunting, fishing, camping, and outdoor recreation skills, enhancing mental, spiritual, and emotional well-being.

title: Veteran Tickets Foundation
description: Offers free tickets to sports, concerts, and family events, enhancing veterans' leisure. Register online, request tickets, and pay a small delivery fee.

title: Reel American Heroes Foundation
description: Provides fishing and duck hunting trips for wounded veterans with gear and guides, fostering camaraderie through nature.

title: Warrior Bonfire Program
description: Hosts retreats for Purple Heart recipients with hunting, fishing, and music therapy, promoting healing and bonding.

title: Operation Art (The Joel Fund)
description: Offers art classes (painting, sculpting) for veterans and families, fostering creativity and community, virtually or in-person.

title: Wounded Warrior Project - Soldier Ride
description: Provides cycling events and adventure retreats (rafting, climbing) with adaptive options, building resilience and community.

title: Sierra Club Military Outdoors
description: Leads hikes, camping, and kayaking in national parks, with conservation projects fostering wellness and teamwork.

title: Challenged Athletes Foundation - Operation Rebound
description: Funds adaptive sports (basketball, triathlons) for disabled veterans with grants and mentorship, building community.

title: Pets for Vets
description: Matches veterans with trained shelter pets, delivering companionship and supplies to reduce loneliness.

title: Outward Bound for Veterans
description: Offers wilderness expeditions (backpacking, canoeing) with gear and instructors, aiding transition and bonding.

title: Heroes on the Water
description: Hosts kayak fishing trips with gear and shore lunches, creating a supportive veteran network.

title: Trellis Farms - Veterans Healing Garden
description: Provides gardening sessions in accessible spaces, promoting mindfulness and community through nature.

title: Anacapa Society - Operation Anacapa
description: Offers free sportfishing trips to California's Channel Islands with meals and therapist support.

title: Appalachian Mountain Club - Veterans Outdoors
description: Leads hikes and camping in Appalachia with gear and guides, fostering teamwork and reflection.

title: Disabled American Veterans (DAV)
description: Hosts social events (barbecues, parties) and volunteering, plus legal help for benefits claims.

title: American Legion
description: Offers social events (dinners, bingo) and volunteer drives at 12,000+ posts, with legal resources.

title: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW)
description: Provides social clubs with poker nights and picnics, plus legal guidance for benefits.

title: We the Veterans
description: Engages veterans in civic activities (voter drives) and social events (picnics), promoting community.

title: Soldiers' Angels
description: Sends care packages and hosts events (holiday parties), with volunteer roles for veterans.

title: Mission 22
description: Offers free hikes, art workshops, and charity runs, plus financial and legal resources.

title: National Veterans Legal Services Program (NVLSP)
description: Provides free legal help for benefits appeals and trains advocates for veterans nationwide.

title: Veterans Consortium Pro Bono Program
description: Connects veterans with free attorneys for benefits appeals and discharge upgrades.

title: Hope For The Warriors
description: Offers emergency grants for rent and utilities, plus counseling for post-9/11 veterans.

title: Disabled Veterans National Foundation (DVNF)
description: Provides up to $1,000 for housing and utilities, connecting veterans to resources.

title: Operation Homefront
description: Delivers rent, utility, and repair aid, plus transitional housing for veterans.

title: Coalition to Support America's Heroes
description: Offers emergency aid for housing and repairs to post-9/11 disabled veterans.

title: Team Red, White & Blue (Team RWB)
description: Hosts workouts, sports, and adventures, connecting veterans through local chapters.

title: The Mission Continues
description: Empowers veterans with service projects (building, disaster aid), fostering leadership and camaraderie.

title: Operation Second Chance
description: Provides financial aid and retreats (fishing, hunting) for morale and family fun.

title: Veterans Adventure Group
description: Organizes hiking, skiing, and rafting trips with gear, fostering connection and resilience.

title: Code of Support Foundation
description: Offers financial counseling, emergency funds, and resource navigation with case managers.

title: Armed Forces Vacation Club (AFVC)
description: Offers discounted vacation packages to active duty, guard, reserve, and retired military members, providing weeklong stays at resorts worldwide starting at $369. Includes a Vacation Planning Resource Center with travel tips.

title: In Honor of Our Troops Foundation (IHOOT)
description: Provides free vacations and year-round discounted accommodation rates for veterans and their families, focusing on rest, recuperation, and family reconnection.

title: WeSalute+ Travel
description: Offers exclusive travel discounts on hotels, car rentals, cruises, and flights for WeSalute members, with partnerships including United Airlines and Carnival Cruise Line.

title: The American Legion Auxiliary (ALA)
description: Supports veterans through community service projects, social events, and volunteer opportunities, fostering fellowship and patriotic involvement across local units.

title: Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA)
description: Provides advocacy, community events, and support groups for veterans with spinal cord injuries, promoting accessibility, fellowship, and adaptive recreation.

title: The Military Order of the Purple Heart (MOPH)
description: Offers community activities, social events, and recognition ceremonies for Purple Heart recipients, fostering camaraderie and honoring service.

title: The Marine Corps League (MCL)
description: Supports Marine veterans through community activities, social events, and volunteer opportunities, strengthening networks and honoring Marine traditions.

title: The Navy Club of the United States (NCUS)
description: Engages Navy veterans through community activities, social events, and networking, fostering connections and honoring naval service.

title: The Air Force Sergeants Association (AFSA)
description: Supports Air Force veterans with community activities, social events, and advocacy, enhancing fellowship and honoring enlisted service.

title: The Coast Guard Chief's Association (CGCA)
description: Engages Coast Guard veterans through community activities, social events, and networking, fostering connections and honoring service.

title: The American Legion's Legal Assistance Program
description: Provides legal help through local posts for benefits claims, discharge upgrades, and housing law, with trained advocates assisting veterans.

title: The National Organization of Veterans' Advocates (NOVA)
description: Offers legal assistance and advocacy for veterans on benefits claims, discharge upgrades, and non-health-related legal issues.

title: Houston Bar Association's Veterans Legal Initiative
description: Provides free legal advice and representation for civil matters, including housing, family law, and consumer issues, serving Houston-area veterans.

title: Texas Veterans Legal Assistance Project (VLAP)
description: Offers free legal help to low-income Texas veterans on family law, housing, employment, and consumer issues, with a focus on rural areas.

title: USA Cares
description: Provides emergency financial aid for rent, utilities, and bills to veterans facing hardships, with quick-response grants.

title: Operation First Response
description: Offers financial aid for rent, utilities, groceries, clothing, and transportation to veterans and their families in need.

title: The American Legion's Temporary Financial Assistance Program
description: Provides financial help to minor children of veterans for basic needs, ensuring family stability during hardships.

title: The Military Order of the Purple Heart's Financial Assistance Program
description: Offers emergency financial aid to Purple Heart recipients and their families for essential needs and stability.

title: The Paralyzed Veterans of America's Financial Assistance Program
description: Provides financial support to veterans with spinal cord injuries for essential needs, accessibility, and quality of life.

title: U.S.VETS
description: Offers transitional and permanent housing, emergency shelter, and supportive services for at-risk and homeless veterans.

title: Tunnel to Towers Foundation - Homeless Veteran Program
description: Provides housing assistance, Veterans Villages, and supportive services to end veteran homelessness nationwide.

title: Veterans Advocacy Services
description: Dedicated to providing services to any veteran of the United States armed forces toward the resolution of any medical, economic, social or situational dilemma. Services include advocacy before medical boards-of-review and representation in health-related matters.

title: REE Medical
description: Specializes in helping veterans obtain accurate medical documentation to support VA disability claims. Connects veterans with experienced providers who document symptom severity and worsening conditions, providing thorough evidence for disability ratings.

title: Veterans Business Outreach Center (VBOC) Program
description: Provides entrepreneurial development services such as business training, counseling, and resource partner referrals to service members, veterans, National Guard and Reserve members, military spouses, and family members.

title: Boots to Business
description: An entrepreneurial education and training program offered by the SBA as part of the Department of Defense's Transition Assistance Program (TAP). Includes a two-day in-person course and follow-on online courses.

title: Boots to Business Reboot
description: Extends the Boots to Business program to veterans of all eras, National Guard, Reserve members, and their spouses. Includes a two-step training program with an Introduction to Entrepreneurship course and online follow-ups.
contact: Contact through local VBOCs or SBA district offices

title: SBA 7(a) Loan Program with Veterans Advantage
description: Offers loans up to $5 million with waived upfront guaranty fees for loans up to $350,000 for veteran-owned businesses.
contact: Contact through local SBA district offices or preferred lenders

title: Military Reservist Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program (MREIDL)
description: Provides loans to businesses suffering economic injury due to an essential employee's active duty call.

title: USDA Rural Development Business Programs
description: Offers over 40 loan, grant, and technical assistance programs for rural businesses, including veterans.
contact: Contact through local USDA Rural Development offices

title: Vets First Contracting Program
description: Allows certified veteran-owned small businesses to compete for VA set-aside contracts.

title: Veteran Women Igniting the Spirit of Entrepreneurship (V-WISE)
description: A training program for women veterans and female military spouses/partners, including a 4-week online course and an in-person capstone conference.
location: National, with conferences in various cities

title: Startup Training Resources to Inspire Veteran Entrepreneurship (STRIVE)
description: A six-week training program for veterans and military-connected entrepreneurs, providing training and post-program support.

title: Veterans in Residence
description: A 10-week virtual business startup program for veteran and military spouse entrepreneurs, including weekly videos, feasibility analysis, and live Q&A webinars.

title: National Veteran Small Business Coalition (NVSBC)
description: Provides training, networking, and advocacy for veteran small business entrepreneurs in the federal market.

title: Veteran Small Business Award
description: Offers grants from $4,000 to $15,000 to veteran entrepreneurs.

title: Warrior Rising
description: Empowers veterans and military spouses through education, business coaching, and professional development, including the Warrior Academy with self-paced video modules.

title: Entrepreneurship Bootcamp for Veterans (EBV)
description: A bootcamp training program for post-9/11 veterans, including a 30-day online course, a 9-day residency, and 12 months of support.

title: SCORE
description: Provides free business mentoring, workshops, and resources for veteran entrepreneurs, with veteran mentors available.
contact: Phone: 1-800-634-0245 or contact form on the website

title: Small Business Grant Program
description: Provides $10,000 grants to veteran and military spouse entrepreneurs.

title: Second Service Foundation
description: Provides coaching, resources, and capital for military entrepreneurs, including veterans.

title: VetFran
description: Connects veterans with over 500 franchise opportunities, offering discounts and resources.

title: Veteran Entrepreneurial Training & Resource Network (VETRN)
description: Offers a free 28-week program covering small business fundamentals.

title: Veterans In Business (VIB) Network
description: Provides education, resources, and advocacy, connecting veteran businesses with opportunities.

title: National Veterans Entrepreneurship Program (VEP)
description: A two-phase training program with online and in-person components, offered by universities like Oklahoma State.
location: National, with in-person sessions at university locations

title: Veteran Institute for Procurement (VIP)
description: Offers free training to help veteran-owned businesses become procurement-ready for federal contracting.

title: Farmer Veteran Fellowship Fund
description: Provides financial assistance for veterans in the early stages of farming or ranching, with awards ranging from $1,000 to $5,000.

title: NASE Growth Grants
description: Offers $4,000 grants quarterly to small business owners, with veterans receiving a 15% discount on the annual membership fee.

title: Veteran Entrepreneur Program
description: Supports veteran-led companies with high-growth potential from idea stage to Series A, offering free participation, mentorship, and capital access.
contact: Contact through the application form on the website
location: National, with cohorts in locations like Bentonville, AR, and Tysons Corner, VA

title: Hiring Veterans: Jobs of the week for March 31, 2025
description: This post contains links to local, partner, state, and federal jobs for the week of March 31, 2025.
